0.Title: The Coveted Starting Player
0.Description: Can be bought for 1 of any of: Stone, Clay, Silk, Boar, Glass, Gold, Cattle, Carrot, Food.
0.Snark: Because just going around in a circle is not strategic enough.

1.Title: The Building Building Building
1.Snark: Really, it's just a coincidence that we happen to also be housed in a building. In fact, we built our own building. We did not need a building building building building building.

62.Title: Free Food!
62.Snark: Side benefit: easier planning! You don't have to think about how to make your food now!

65.Title: The Early Investment
65.Description: You must play this card before playing an Engine.
65.Snark: Does nothing now, but it will pay off later. The engine can wait.

66.Title: More Grain!
66.Description: You may trash this card for 1 Food.
66.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

67.Title: More Grain!
67.Description: You may trash this card for 1 Food.
67.Snark: Grain: the best breeder of them all.

68.Title: The Wildcard Building
68.Description: You may trash 1 Silk for any 2 Resources, any number of times.
68.Snark: Be sure to take this from someone who has collected silk.

69.Title: Sheep Breed!
69.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

70.Title: Sheep Breed!
70.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

71.Title: Sheep Breed!
71.Snark: Sheep: the rabbits of farm animals.

72.Title: The Stone Building Building Building
72.Description: You do not need to pay any required Stone for Buildings.
72.Snark: Technically, we're just a shack made out of fiberglass, but this game doesn't need another resource.

73.Title: The Wood Building Building Building
73.Description: You do not need to pay any required Wood for Buildings
73.Snark: Not to be confused with the Building Wood Building, which is what we call our indoor arboretum

74.Title: The Clay Building Building Building
74.Description: You do not need to pay any required Clay for Buildings.
74.Snark: It is by pure coincidence that we actually need Clay for our building.

75.Title: The Obligatory Trader
75.Description: You may substitute 2 different Resources for 1 of any Resource, any number of times.
75.Snark: I'm sure I'll use this enough to justify its purchase.

76.Title: The Military Building
76.Description: Highest Military may trash any 1 available Special at round start.
76.Snark: And how do we feel about going military right about now?

77.Title: The Cattle Engine
77.Description: You may trash 1 Cattle for 2 Food, and/or 1 Cattle for any Resource.
77.Snark: Don't base your entire strategy on this card.

79.Title: Even More Grain!
79.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food

80.Title: Even More Grain!
80.Description: You may also use this card for 1 Food

81.Title: The Cheap Building
81.Snark: Hey, VPs are VPs. Every little bit counts.

82.Snark: Hey, VPs are VPs. Every little bit counts.
82.PreReq:  Wood  Wood  Building

83.Title: The Combo Building
83.Snark: Nice! Way to get some points on the board.
83.PreReq:  Clay  Wood  Building

84.Title: The Good Building
84.Snark: Good move. Not Great. But Good.
84.PreReq:  Clay  Clay  Building

85.Title: The Great Building
85.Snark: Don't get all your VPs out too early now. We've got an endgame.
85.PreReq:  Wood  Stone  Building

86.Title: The Amazing Building
86.Snark: Just when you think you've pulled ahead, someone else will get a bigger building than this.
86.PreReq:  Clay  Stone  Building

87.Title: The Premium Building
87.Snark: Seems like a lot now, but this won't win you the game alone.
87.PreReq:  Stone  Stone  Building

88.Title: Cattle Breed!
88.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

89.Title: Cattle Breed!
89.Snark: I won't tell you how we got this cow to breed by itself.

90.Title: Eat More Veggies!
90.Description: You may also Trash this card for 2 Food.
90.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

91.Title: Eat More Veggies!
91.Description: You may also Trash this card for 2 Food.
91.Snark: This is a garden, not some sort of weird patch that passively injects beta-Carotene into your skin.

92.Title: The Arms Race
92.Description: Highest Military may trash any 1 available Special at round start.
92.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

93.Title: The Arms Race
93.Description: Highest Military may trash any 1 available Special at round start.
93.Snark: I'm pretty sure this strategy worked for me at least once.

94.Title: The Military Commitment
94.Description: Highest Military may trash any 1 available Special at round start.

95.Title: Sheep Climb!
95.Description: Upon playing, climb 1 rung on the Point Ladder
95.Snark: Are we climbing a sheep, or are is the sheep doing the climbing?

96.Title: Grain Climb!
96.Description: Upon playing, climb 1 rung on the Point Ladder
96.Snark: Thematically this card makes no sense.

97.Title: Clay Climb!
97.Description: Upon playing, climb 1 rung on the Point Ladder
97.Snark: Always make sure your clay ladders are kiln-dried before embarking.

98.Title: Stone Climb!
98.Description: Upon playing, climb 1 rung on the Point Ladder

99.Title: The Unfair Deck Dive
99.Description: Upon playing, retrieve any Trashed card and play it immediately without prerequisites.
99.Snark: Playing this has the hidden advantage of making your opponents hate you.

100.Title: The Payoff Strategy
100.Description: Before the Endgame phase, you may take 1 Payoff card of your choice.
100.Snark: Which is more fun… scoring more points for myself, or denying points from my opponents?

101.Title: The One-and-Done Card
101.Description: You may trash this card for any 2 Resources.
101.Snark: Make it count. No pressure. Are you sure you that's a good enough use for this card?? There's probably a better move.

102.Title: The Payoff Payoff
102.Description: 3 VPs for each Payoff you have placed.
102.Snark: This card is as close at this game gets to Victory Point Points.

103.Title: The Expensive Payoff
103.Snark: Glad you didn't have to eat these!

104.Title: The Unexpected Payoff
104.Snark: This card favors those who have this deck memorized.

105.Title: The Diversified Strategy Payoff
105.Description: 5 VP for each type: Sheep, Wild Boar, Cattle, Glass, Silk, Grain, Carrot.
105.Snark: This is to make you feel better about having unused stuff.

106.Title: The Investment Payoff
106.Description: 8VP if you have Invested plus 3VP for each Gold.
106.Snark: See! I told you that card would pay off.

107.Title: The Unused Resources Payoff
107.Description: 3 VP for each Wood, Sheep, or Grain
107.Snark: Hey, at least you know nobody else is going for it.

108.Title: The Payoff With Math
108.Description: At game end, take the number of Glass and Silk you have. Square that for VPs.
108.Snark: Go ahead and take your next turn, this is gonna take me a moment.

109.Title: The Military Payoff
109.Description: 3 VP for each Soldier, +3 additional VP if you end the game with the most soldiers.

110.Title: The Building Payoff Building
110.Description: 1 VP for each Building you've played
110.Snark: You had to see this one coming.

111.Title: Initiate Endgame!
111.Description: All Blockers must be paid by the end of this turn. Initiate Endgame.
111.Snark: You didn't forget about food, did you?
